Day in the Life

of a door to door sales rep

Check it out!

Morning Routine

I started each day at 8am. Not even early haha. The morning is focused on stacking dubs. By the time I get on the doors, I need to have a couple wins under my belts so my mind is right. If I got these things done in the morning, I knew it was going to be a successful day:

  • Read my scriptures and pray to connect with God. He is my strength and the only reason I have this opportunity.
  • Work out. It was usually pretty short. 4 exercises with 3 sets each. I focused on mobility and core strength.
  • Stretch. This helped me stop, think, and get my body feeling extra lose for the day.
  • Shower and get ready. They say you only perform as good as you look HAHA! And I was looking fine!
  • Eat breakfast. Most important meal fo the day folks.

Morning Meeting

Morning meeting started at 10am at the office. This wasn't just a time to hang out like most other companies do. This is where we train and get better because at the Grit, wer're different. 1-2 hours of training and then Los or Dan would break us down with crazy hype!

OFF TO HOOD BABY!

Knocking

We would get on the doors as quick as possible after meeting so usually 11:30-12:30. This is what we live for. Getting better every day, working 100% all the time, becoming the best versions of ourselves, and making tons of money! The mental demons on the doors are like none other. It takes a soldier to get through. But it's so fun once you get good at it. We knock until 9:30 every night no matter what.

Night-time

We stop every night at 9:30. Unless your car partner isn't there to pick you up yet which is basically every night! WHAT A BLESSING! More time on the doors baby! And if you get nightcrawler (the latest deal), you get to shoot for $50 the next day at morning meeting.

Alright for real. Night is super chill. We drive home, usually get dinner on the way, and hit the hay as soon as possible haha. Sometimes we cook or play games to spice things up. But life really is just a grind and we love it! That makes the off-season that much better!
